properties.entry: Controls access to create, edit, and delete dynamic billing files.
Controls access to Versacom Serial Number SortBy display.
Controls access to ExpressCom Serial Number SortBy display.
Controls access to DCU SA205 Serial Number SortBy display.
Controls access to DCU SA305 Serial Number SortBy display.
The commands group name for the displayed commands.
Controls the ability to read values from a device.
Controls the ability to write values to a device.
Controls the ability to control a disconnect to a device.
Controls the ability to read values from an LM device.
Controls the ability to write values to an LM device.
Controls the ability to control an LM device.
Controls the ability to read values from a Cap Control device.
Controls the ability to write values to a Cap Control device.
Controls the ability to control a Cap Control device.
Controls the ability to execute commands which do not fall under another role property.
Controls the ability to execute manual commands.
Controls access to web Commander applications.
Controls access to client Commander application.
Controls access to the ability to manage custom commands in web commander.
Controls access to Load Management in the View menu.
Controls access to System in the View menu.
Versacom utility address range; must be a positive integer no greater than 254.
Controls the ability to configure mutual exclusion of transmissions.
Controls access to System view of User, User Group, and Role Group for non Super Users.
Controls access to optional Load Management products (SA and Ripple).
Controls access to member management of Direct Programs.
The number of minutes a login is disabled when an account is locked out.
The number of login attempts before an account is locked out.
The number of days before a login is expired and needs to be changed.
The number of hours a user has to wait before changing their password again.
The minimum number of characters a password has to be before it passes.
The number of different passwords retained before a user can reuse a password.
The number of policy rules that are required to be able to save a password.
Uppercase characters count toward the required policy quality check. (A, B, C, ... Z).
Lowercase characters count toward the required policy quality check. (a, b, c, ... z).
Base 10 digits count toward the required policy quality check. (0, 1, 2, ... 9).
Nonalphanumic characters count toward the required password rules check. (~, !, @, #, $, %, ^, &, *, _, -, +, =, `, |, (, ), {, }, [, ], :, ", ', <, >, ,, ., ?, /).
Controls access to administrative group reports.
Controls access to AMR group reports.
Controls access to statistical group reports.
Controls access to Load Management group reports.
Controls access to Cap Control group reports.
Controls access to Database group reports.
Controls access to Stars group reports.
Controls access to C&I Curtailment group reports.
Controls access level of MACS Schedules: Create(0x0000000C), Enable(0x000000C0), Start/Stop(0x00000C00).
The number of rows shown before creating a new page of data.
Controls access to TDC Display options: Disable MACS(0x00001000), Disable Control Areas(0x00004000), Disable Displays(0x0000F000), Disable Alarm Colors(0x80000000).
The number of unacked alarms to display in the quick access list.
The number of decimal places to show for real values.
Controls access to display Reduction in All Control Areas display.
Controls access to view, create, edit, or delete Trends.
The disclaimer displayed for operator metering pages.
Controls access to retrieve meter data on demand.
The minimum duration (in minutes) between get data now events.
The maximum number of get data now scans available daily.
The URL of the main landing page following log in.
The web client cascading style sheet.
The URL of the main login page and redirect when user logs out.
Java Web Start to access client applications is no longer supported.
Disable display of stack trace when exception encountered.
The time (in milliseconds) in which dynamic data (Ex. point data) will update.
A comma-separated list of URLs for CSS files that will be included on every Standard Page.
The name of the theme file which defines custom web page text and formatting.
Controls access to receive and display point alarms as alerts.
The default time zone (e.g. America/Denver, America/Chicago, America/Los_Angeles, or America/New_York).
The time in minutes before a user's session will expire.
The text to display for fixed/static Cap Banks.
Controls access to Cap Control modules.
Controls access to Cap Control Trends Action.
The number of decimal places to show for Power Factor real values.
Controls access to local controls (e.g. OV/UV) for Substations, Substation Buses, Feeders, and Cap Banks.
Controls access to create, edit, delete, and assign Cap Control objects.
Controls access to flip command for Cap Banks with CBC 701X controller.
Controls access to Cap Bank Additional Info display.
Sum of all Cap Bank sizes having these states. Comma-separated list of "operationalState:controlState", e.g. Switched:Open,StandAlone:Open.
Sum of all Cap Bank sizes having these states. Comma-separated list of "operationalState:controlState", e.g. Switched:Close,StandAlone:CloseFail.
Sum of all Cap Bank sizes having these states. Comma-separated list of "operationalState:controlState", e.g. Switched:Open,StandAlone:Open.
Sum of all Cap Bank sizes having these states. Comma-separated list of "operationalState:controlState", e.g. Switched:Closed,Disabled:Close.
Controls access to Add comments to Cap Control objects.
Controls access to Modify comments on Cap Control objects.
Controls access to system level operations i.e. Disable System or Reset All Op Counters..
Forces a default comment to be used if one is not entered.
Controls access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for Cap Control Areas.
Controls access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for Cap Control Substations.
Controls access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for Cap Control Sub Buses.
Controls access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for Cap Control Feeders.
Controls access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for Cap Control Cap Banks/CBCs.
Controls whether to display confirmation pop-ups for all Cap Control commands, only Operational commands or for no commands.
Controls access to the Cap Control importers.
Controls access to general account information.
Controls access to program control history.
Controls access to program opt out/reenable.
Controls access to the energy company contact us information.
Controls access for customers to change their own login username.
Controls access to program multiple thermostats at one time.
Controls access for customers to change their own login password.
The duration, in days, for the customer Opt Out period. (Use commas to separate multiple values: Ex. 1,3,4,5).
Configure number of opt outs allowed during a specific month. JSON formatted comma-separated, e.g. [{"start":3,"stop":10,"limit":3},{"start":11,"stop":2,"limit":6}].
Controls access to manage contact information.
Prevents residential side opt outs from being available for scheduling beyond the current day.
Enables display of sign-out link when accessing their account pages.
Controls the ability to select individual devices or forces all device selection when opting out. When true, individual device selection is unavailable and all devices are forced to opt out.
Enables enrollment in multiple programs within an appliance category.
Displays a second web page that allows for enrollment by individual device per program.
Enables auto mode functionality for the account enrollment by individual device per program.
Enables program constraints to be CHECKED before starting.
Enables program constraints to be OBSERVED before starting.
Enables program constraints to be OVERRIDDEN before starting.
The default program constraint selection prior to starting a program. (Observe, Override, Check).
Controls the ability to change gears as part of manually stopping a load program.
Enables per object control access permissions. Set to false to ignore permissions and allow access to all Demand Response objects.
Controls access to view Control Areas.
Checks the start now check box by default in Demand Response.
The default duration (in minutes) for a control event in Demand Response.
Checks the scheduled stop check box by default in Demand Response.
The default start time for a control event in the format (hh:mm). It will use the current time if no time has been supplied.
Controls access to control Scenarios, Control Areas, Programs and Load Groups.
Controls access to view Asset Availability for Scenarios, Control Areas, Programs, and Load Groups.
Controls access to actions and information related to ecobee devices.
Controls access to change gears for Scenarios, Control Areas, and Programs. Requires Allow DR Control.
Controls access to enable or disable Control Areas, Programs and Load Groups. Requires Allow DR Control.
Controls the ability to create, edit, or delete demand response setup and configuration i.e Load Groups, Programs, Control Areas. Demand Response Role controls view access.
Allow access to Edge DR features and APIs.
Controls access to shed and restore at Load Group level. Requires Allow DR Control.
Controls access to view Control Area Trigger related information.
Controls access to view Control Area, Program, and Load Group Priority.
Controls access to view Program and Load Group Reduction.
The number of outgoing channels assigned to the specified voice application.
The URL used to initiate a call; see documentation for allowed variables.
A Java Regular Expression that will be matched against the output of the URL to determine if the call was successful.
Location of root template; either a URL base where the notification templates will be stored (file: or http:) or a directory relative to YUKON_BASE.
Controls access to full control of all energy companies and other administrator features.
Controls access to edit the user's energy company settings.
Controls access to manage the energy company's members.
Controls access to monitoring of all batched switch commands.
Controls access to monitoring of all scheduled opt out events.
Controls access to operator logins on the Energy Company page. Only applicable for member company.
Controls access to routes on the Energy Company page. Only applicable for member company.
Enables multiple user-created warehouses instead of a single generic warehouse.
Controls access to configure the MultiSpeak Interfaces.
Controls access to configure user based per object control access of Demand Response and Cap Control objects.
Controls access to create and edit device configurations.
Controls access to view existing device configurations.
Controls access to manually build Lucene indexes. i.e. global Search or picker dialogs.
Controls access to view or download log files.
Controls access to database migration tool.
Controls access to manage all user defined dashboards.
Controls access to manage all user defined attributes.
Controls access to the C&I Curtailment operator functionality. When false, only the C&I Curtailment user pages are available.
Controls access to customer residence information.
Controls access to metering interval data.
Controls access to program control history.
Controls access to program opt out/reenable feature.
Controls access to web services that retrieve LM data.
Controls access to web services that perform LM control.
Controls access to change a customer login username.
Controls access to change a customer login password.
Controls the ability to program multiple thermostats at one time.
Controls access to assign new trends to the customer.
Controls access to create individual account action.
Controls access to assets import (customer and hardware).
The duration (in days) for the customer Opt Out period. (Use commas to separate multiple values: Ex. 1,3,4,5).
Controls access to send configs and connects/disconnects to switches.
Controls access to edit and delete customer account information.
Prevents operator-side opt outs from being available for scheduling beyond the current day.
Controls access to the current opt out status in Opt Out Admin.
Controls access to enable or disable opt outs for the rest of the day.
Controls access to cancel (reenable) all currently opted out devices.
Controls access to change from Opt Outs count against limits today to Opt Outs do not count.
Controls access to asset account search.
Controls access to edit opt out surveys.
Controls access to bulk import operations.
Controls access to bulk update operations.
Controls access to edit Device Groups (Add/Remove Group, update name, etc.).
Controls access to modify contents of a Device Group (Add to/Remove from group, etc.).
Controls access to group command actions.
Controls access to mass change collection actions. Includes all Mass Change actions.
Controls access to locate route action.
Controls access to mass delete devices action.
Controls access to Add, Update and Remove Points collection actions.
Controls access to Device Configs Change/Remove collection action.
Controls access to Device Configs Upload/Validate Config collection actions.
Controls access to Archived Data Analysis collection action.
Controls access to FDR Translation Manager bulk operation.
Controls access to Archived Data Export.
Controls access to Connect/Disconnect collection action.
Controls access to Demand Reset collection action.
Controls access to RF data streaming configuration actions.
Hardware Add by Serial Number Range
Controls access to add hardware by serial number range.
Hardware Update by Serial Number Range
Controls access to update hardware by serial number range.
Hardware Delete by Serial Number Range
Controls access to delete hardware by serial number range.
Configure opt out command to also contain a restore command.
Controls access to Inventory Configuration Tool.
Controls access to submit a (past) profile collection request.
Enables automatic archiving of move in/move out transactions.
Controls access to process a move in/move out.
Controls access to start/stop scanning of profile data.
Controls access to process a high bill complaint.
Controls access to Tamper Flag Processing.
Controls access to the Outage Notification Monitor.
Controls access to the Porter Response Monitor.
Controls access to Disconnect, Connect, and Arm operations.
Controls access to the Device Data Monitor.
Controls access to the Water Leak Report.
Controls access to the Usage Threshold Report.
Controls access to odds for control.
Controls access to view, start/stop, enable/disable, edit, create, delete for MACS Script.
Controls access to create, delete, or update scheduled reads. If false, access is view only.
Controls access to view all work orders.
Controls access to create work orders.
Controls access to run work orders reports.
Label for the additional order number field.
Controls access to create, edit, or delete endpoint devices. i.e Meters, Relays. Metering Role controls view access for meter endpoints.
Controls access to edit, delete, or manually add point data values.
Controls access to view, create, edit, or delete points.
Controls access to view, create, edit, or delete notes.
Controls access to manage infrastructure devices. i.e. RF Gateways, Comm Channels.
